item.description:
The Lynn Woods Reservation was founded in 1881, the second largest municipal park in the United States, is a 2,200 acre municipal forest park located in Lynn, Massachusetts. The Woods offers over 30 miles of scenic trails (10 miles of them are old carriage roads). The forest reserve consists of ponds, wetlands, streams, deciduous/evergreen forest and rocky ledge. Three active reservoirs provide pretty pond-like scenery among natural forestland, as well as clean water for the City of Lynn.

Items of interest are:

1. Dungeon Rock is a well-loved underground tunnel with a history of pirate lore and treasure seekers. If you want to go down into the tunnel please bring a flashlight or headlight.

2. The Stone Tower is a 48 ft. tall field stone tower on the top of Burrill Hill.  Set on the highest point in Lynn, this rustic field stone tower commands an impressive view of Lynn's waterfront, Boston and beyond.

3. The Rose Garden. In the 1920's Lynn Park Superintendent John P. Morrissey created the Lynn Woods Rose Garden, one of the loveliest public gardens in the City of Lynn's history.

4. The abandoned steel fire tower.

Some links:   http://www.ci.lynn.ma.us/citydepartments_lynnwoods.shtml

http://www.flw.org/

A map:   http://www.flw.org/maps.html

A map of the park: http://www.flw.org/pdf_files/lwmap.pdf

There will be some photos in the photo album as a preview of some of the sites/views on this hike.

http://www.meetup.com/Manchester-Doggie-Paws/photos/8398012/
item.how_to_find_us: Go through the gates for Lynn Wood Reservation and park in the parking lot. Look for a bunch of people with dogs.

group.name: Human Soles & Doggie Paws Hikers & Walkers of Manchester, NH

item.name: Lynn Woods Reservation - Lynn, MA - Easy 5 mi. Hike (approximate)
